page.title: 18LLANSTEFFAN AREA: SPORT
page.content: We make our own enjoyment. We have two soccer clubs, one in each village, and Llansteffan has cricket and tennis clubs. Badminton is played in the Memorial Hall. A few people have boats. Angling is probably the most popular sport among men and boys, mostly on the rivers for trout, sewin, and salmon. Llanybri Wildfowlers and Conservation Club exists chiefly to regulate shooting on the Taf estuary. Swimming at Llansteffan is only safe around high tide because of the treacherous current so some people go to Carmarthen Leisure Centre pool. A handful of people go horse riding. Snooker is played in the Ben Harries Institute, and darts and pool in the pubs. Holiday activities include a mini-marathon, terrier-racing on the Morfa, folk dancing and a car treasure hunt.
